revised_title: Observations on the Generation of Insects and the Role of Semen Masculum
tldr: The author, Mr. Leeuwenhoeck, investigates the role of semen masculum in the generation of insects and the function of the uterus and ovaries. He observes the living animals in the semen and concludes that the uterus, not the vagina, is responsible for the reception and enclosure of the semen masculum. He also refutes the idea that eggs are sucked from the ovaries in generation.
